zone.line: We will now visit him — after this strain
He ever communes with himself again
not
And sees nor hears any in the room
; having said
we & he led
These words; ? called the keeper,
the weight
Hell appear To an apartment opening on the sea
There the poor wretch was sitting mournfully
Near a piano, his pale fingers twined
One with the other -, & the rain & wind
an ooze
Rushed thro the open casement & did sway
brackish
His hair & starred it with the dewy spray
leaning
His head was resting upon a music-book
And he was muttering , & his lean limbs
shook
I could not see his face, but thro his hair
There gleamed a yet dark
I saw his bloodless cheek, & it was fair
His lips were pressed against the music leaf
In hue too beautiful for health.
